snippet: The state and federal education departments had warned that districts with high refusal rates risked losing funds. But it is far from certain such action will be taken.
abstract: New York State and federal education officials must decide whether to punish school districts with low percentage of students who took state-mandated exams in 2015; 20 percent of third- through eighth-grade students did not take this year’s exams, quadruple number from 2014.
lead_paragraph: The state and federal education departments had warned that districts with high refusal rates risked losing funds. But it is far from certain such action will be taken.

headline.main: New York Schools With Many Opting Out of Tests May Be Penalized
headline.print_headline: Test Boycotts May Not Hurt School Funds
